title: Financial Health: Advice & Interest

sections.title: How Savings Grow
sections.content:
When you save, the bank rewards you with extra money called **Interest**.

- **Interest Rate (APY)**: The percentage of money you earn per year.
- **High-Yield Savings**: Special accounts with a higher interest rate (e.g., 4% instead of 0.1%).
- **Compound Interest**: When your interest earns more interest. Your money grows faster!
- **Growth**: The increase in your total balance over time.

sections.title: Grammar: Advice with 'Should' & 'Shouldn't'
sections.content:
Use **Should** for good advice and **Shouldn't** for bad habits.

- **Good Advice**:
  - *You **should** have an emergency fund.*
  - *You **should** check interest rates every year.*
- **Bad Habits**:
  - *You **shouldn't** leave all your money in a 0% account.*
  - *You **shouldn't** spend your interest immediately.*

**Question Form**:
- *Should I open a high-yield account?* Yes, you should!

sections.title: Smart Financial Habits
sections.content:
- **Automate**: Let the app save for you.
- **Compare**: Look for the best interest rates online.
- **Reinvest**: Keep your interest in the account to grow more.
